How was the amplitude measurement window selected or identified?
details: For future help: e.g. for a priori - mean of a window decided in advance; e.g. visual inspection of an a priori decided range or window around a peak found in an a priori decided range; e.g., for data driven - mass uni analysis of the entire epoch, visual inspecion of the entire epoch or a vaguely defined (i.e. flexible) general time range
choices: a priori | time window or peak was selected/identified using data-driven methods from a broader window which was selected a priori | data-driven selection/identification of the time window or peak from the entire epoch | other

question: Select the a priori procedure which was used for amplitude measurement in this time window.
choices: The same as in previous literature | based on previous literature, but not exact replication | theory driven novel window selection | other

question: Literature references in which this exact window selection was used, separated by semicolon and space
Literature references for a-priori selection plus reasons for deviation/combination of references, separated by semicolon and space
Theory behind a-priori window selection (including implementation of regions, thresholds etc, and references if relevant)
Describe your a-priori window selection other than those listed
Provide the start of the a priori selected time window.
details: for a priori time windows only: Please provide here the start of the window which was used to measure amplitude.

question: Provide the end of the a priori selected time window.
details: for a priori time windows only: Please provide here the end of the window which was used to measure amplitude.

question: Select the procedure which was used to identify start and end of the time window.
details: for future help: vis. inspecion across all conditions also known as flattened average approach, for more details see Gaspelin and Luck or  https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1008286
choices: visual inspection of grand averages in separate conditions across participants | visual inspection of grand average collapsed across all conditions and participants | consecutive significant tests | mass univariate analysis | window around a peak | peak | other

details: Question for the meta-data specialists, how to implement multiple selection of items... e.g., 6.4.1a, 6.4.1b, 6.4.1c and how to handle the further flow if there are multiple measures - e.g. multiple components or both midpoint and onset latenciesf

question: Where is the onset of your latency measure?
choices: midpoint - peak | midpoint - local peak | midpoint - 50% area | midpoint - other

question: How did you select the peak of your latency measure?
details: Select procedure which was used for latency measurement in this time window and describe all details neccessary for replicating this procedure in Further clarification.

question: Latency was calculated from the following waveforms.
details: Please specify details of how the waveforms were constructed in the further clarification text. The details should be sufficient to allow replication.  For discussion: any way to help with reporting complex steps such as measurement from waveforms that are transformed by source localization?

question: How did you calculate your waveforms for analysis? Describe in detail sufficient to allow replication.
Approach to selection of the window within which latency was located (multi choice)
details: A priori: the window is selected in advance Data-driven: the measurement window is selected based on data obtained in the current study. In a data driven approach, either a wider window or the entire epoch are analyzed or examined to determine which will be the final analysis window.  Entire epoch: latency is identified based on the entire epoch instead of a narrower window (e.g. peak of the entire waveform, mass univariate approch on the entire epoch etc.). Please specify details in the Further clarification column [if 1 was selected, jump to 6.4.2.1; if 2 was selected, jumpe to 6.4.2.2] If 3 or 4 was selected, specify in "further clarification" filed.
choices: a priori | data-driven | latency idenfied based on entire epoch | other

question: Select the procedure which was used for latency measurement in this time window.
details: Select procedure which was used for latency measurement in this time window. Please provide references if 1 was selected and rationale if 2 was selected Skip 6.4.2-6.4.4. and jump to 6.4.5.
choices: The same as in previous literature | other
